Class myMap

java.lang.Object
myMap
public class myMap extends Object
The myMap class represents a mapping of letters to information objects.

      protected String str

    • map

      protected LinkedHashMap<String,info> map

  • Constructor Details

    • myMap

      public myMap()
      Default Constructor. Initializes the mapSize to 0 and creates a new LinkedHashMap for the mapping.

    • myMap

      public myMap(String input)
      Constructor with input string. Performs preprocessing on the input string and creates a mapping of letters to information objects.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string.

  • Method Details

    • putInfo

      protected void putInfo(String key, info newInfo)
      Puts a new information object in the mapping with the specified key.
      Parameters:
      key - The key for the mapping.
      newInfo - The information object to be added.

    • getInfo

      protected info getInfo(String key)
      Retrieves the information object associated with the specified key from the mapping.
      Parameters:
      key - The key for the mapping.
      Returns:
      The information object associated with the key, or null if the key is not found.

    • printMap

      public void printMap()
      Prints the mapping to the console.

    • getCount

      protected int getCount(String key)
      Retrieves the count of occurrences for the specified key in the mapping.
      Parameters:
      key - The key for the mapping.
      Returns:
      The count of occurrences for the key, or 0 if the key is not found.

    • getKeys

      protected String[] getKeys()
      Retrieves an array of keys from the mapping.
      Returns:
      An array of keys.

    • isEmpty

      protected boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the letter map is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the letter map is empty, false otherwise.

    • mapSize

      protected int mapSize()
      Retrieves the size of the letter map.
      Returns:
      the size of the letter map.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the letter map.
